contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} '''Kerry Leigh Prendergast''', [[New Zealand Order of Merit|CNZM]] (born 28 March 1953) was the 33rd [[Mayor of Wellington]] (2001–2010). She was the second woman to serve as Mayor of [[Wellington]], succeeding [[Mark Blumsky]]. ==Before politics== Prendergast's professional background is in the health sector as a registered nurse and, for twenty five years, a midwife. She continued her midwifery role alongside her local government work until 2001. She has also been a voluntary grief counsellor. She holds a [[Master of Business Administration|MBA]] degree from [[Victoria University of Wellington]]. ==Local body politics== Prendergast has had a long career in local body politics, having started her political life as a [[Tawa, New Zealand|Tawa Borough]] councillor in 1986. In 1989 she was elected to [[Wellington City Council]] and was re-elected every three years until 2010. In 1995 Prendergast became Deputy Mayor to [[Mark Blumsky]]. In the [[New Zealand general election, 1999|1999 general election]] Prendergast stood as a [[New Zealand National Party|National]] list candidate, ranked 30th on the party's list. However, the National Party did not gain enough of the party vote for Prendergast to enter [[Parliament of New Zealand|Parliament]]. She considered running again at the [[New Zealand general election, 2002|2002 election]], but in 2001 Mark Blumsky announced his intention not to run for the mayoralty again, and endorsed Prendergast's mayoralty candidacy. ===Mayor of Wellington=== Prendergast was elected mayor in 2001 and re-elected in 2004 and 2007. During her time as Mayor, Prendergast instigated the policy of making Wellington the "Creative Capital". She has endorsed changing the [[Flag of New Zealand]].<ref>[http://www.nzflag.com/endorsements.cfm?i=22 NZ Flag.com – Kerry Prendergast]</ref> In the [[Wellington City mayoral election, 2010]], Prendergast was challenged by [[Green Party of Aotearoa New Zealand]] city councillor [[Celia Wade-Brown]] for the Wellington mayoralty. After the counting of special votes, Wade-Brown was declared the winner of a close Wellington mayoral contest by a one hundred and seventy six vote margin, ending nearly a decade of Prendergast's mayoralty.<ref name="3_News_181150">{{cite news |url=http://www.3news.co.nz/Celia-Wade-Brown-wins-Wellington/tabid/419/articleID/181150/Default.aspx |title=Celia Wade Brown wins Wellington |author=Watts, Jerram |date=13 October 2010 |work=[[3 News]] |accessdate=12 October 2011}}</ref> ==Voluntary work== Prendergast is Vice President of Local Government New Zealand and a trustee of the Joe Aspell Trust and the New Zealand International Festival of the Arts. She is also an honorary life member of the [[Katherine Mansfield Birthplace]] Society. Prendergast is patron of a number or Wellington organisations and a director of [[Wellington International Airport]] Limited and the Wellington Region Association of Midwives. She is married and has two daughters and a son. Her son was killed on 31 March 2011 in a riding accident. In the 2011 Queen's Birthday Honours, she was made a Companion of the [[New Zealand Order of Merit]], for services to local body affairs.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Queen's Birthday Honours 2011|url=http://www.dpmc.govt.nz/honours/lists/list.asp?id=58|work=[[Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet (New Zealand)|Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet]]|date=6 June 2011|accessdate=6 June 2011}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef | before = [[Mark Blumsky]]}} {{s-ttl | rows = 1 | title = [[Mayor of Wellington]] |years = 2001–2010}} {{s-aft | after = [[Celia Wade-Brown]]}} {{s-end}} ==External links== * [http://www.kerryprendergast.co.nz Kerry 4 Mayor 2010] * [http://www.wellington.govt.nz/about/mayor/profiles/prendergast.php Wellington City Council – Mayor Prendergast] * [http://www.citymayors.com/mayors/wellington-mayor-prendergast.html CityMayors profile] {{Authority control|VIAF=71181279}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Prendergast, Kerry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = New Zealand politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 28 March 1953 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Prendergast, Kerry}} [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Companions of the New Zealand Order of Merit]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Mayors of Wellington]] [[Category:New Zealand nurses]] [[Category:Women mayors of places in New Zealand]] [[Category:Victoria University of Wellington alumni]] [[Category:New Zealand National Party politicians]] [[Category:New Zealand midwives]]
